newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony says no decision yet on size of JSkyB stake.
newsitem.headline: Sony says no decision yet on size of JSkyB stake.

text.p: Sony Corp said on Thursday it has not yet made a decision on the size of its stake in Japan Sky Broadcasting Co, or JSkyB.

A Sony spokeswoman, commenting on a report in a Japanese financial daily on Thursday that the satellite broadcasting venture would be equally owned by Sony, Softbank Corp and Rupert Murdoch's News Corp Ltd, said no decision on the scale of Sony's stake had been made.
The paper reported earlier this week that Sony was likely to take a quarter stake and that a formal announcement would be made soon.

A Softbank spokesman said in January that the three companies were considering Sony's capital participation in the venture as well as its possible role in providing audiovisual software and broadcasting equipment.
JSkyB is scheduled to start beaming 12 channels into Japan in April, and plans to increase that number to 150 channels by April 1998.
